Basically, you have to stop being such a fucking asshole all the time. Don't worry; I'll elaborate more. Your family history is sad, but not surprising. It definitely fits a profile. And considering how you said you were raised by a Super Nintendo and not some variety of Playstation or X Box I'm gonna guess that you're not young either. Meaning it's well past the time to learn how to interact with people.
And I think a part of your problem is that you've come to define yourself solely by your interests, and likewise define other people by theirs. YOU are not anime or Evil Dead, and likewise someone who doesn't like those things is not making a personal attack. Likewise, these other people are not the Minnesota Vikings or whatever. There is more to them, and there would be more to you if you stopped hiding it.
The other problem here is that you've divided people based on their interests as either "normie" (hilarious considering your video game taste) or as "based 4chan autists!" or whatever the fuck. And I think a lot of that is simply contrarianism on your part. For example, you said you'd date a trekkie, even though you didn't say you're into Star Trek. So why the exception then? Oh right, because Trek isn't "normie" so it's ok for people to like whether you like it or not yourself. And since you have this childish black and white view of the world, you don't seem to realize that there are people out there who like football and Game of Thrones, AND video games and cheesy horror movies. I would know; I'm one of them.
So you need to learn to stop pigeonholing people (yourself included) by their interests, learn to find common ground, and learn to read the room to figure out when people don't want to hear your shit. If you want a family of your own, this is the MINIMUM.

I have tons of money from my job and crypto trading and investments, so money is not really an issue. I'm in my mid 20s and would prefer to be tall while I'm still pretty young. last_replies.name: Anonymous

if you are OP, please remember that there is barely any fucking difference between torso length of a 5'8 person and a 6'1.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>27880082
I dont think the surgery would be a net positive in your life. Your height isnt something to obsess over, other people dont give a rats ass if you were three inches taller. And having a couple inches longer legs won't make you into "what you think should've looked like". That is already in the past.

If you do get the surgery, you will probably need to sit in a wheelchair/walk on crutches for a long time, probably 2-5 months. Osteomyelitis, stiffness, nerve damage, muscle athrophy, muscle tearing, and temporary partial paralysis are real complications. Long term pain medication isnt fun either, don't get hooked on it.

The height thing is in your head, and the people who already know you won't think anything more positive after you get the surgery. Fix something else about yourself if you have to, like getting braces or LASIK. Or spend some money on a person you want to help.

Yeah price low to high.

Never underestimate the cluelessness of the average person. Offerup in my area has lots of stupidly cheap computers. Easy $200+ profit per flip if you know what to look for. Key is to look for bad pictures and descriptions. If you can identify the model and specs from potato pictures you'll often find higher end models that are underpriced because the seller is lazy. And no one else knows what they are so they just sit there. And then the buyer reduces the price even more because they don't sell and by that point the listing is buried in the algorithm and you're probably the only one still looking at it so you can basically name your own price.

You can also buy bulk older model computers from wholesalers and auction sites. More legit because you have paperwork and can prove you didn't steal them. Most "liquidation wholesalers" are just looking to scam idiots chasing easy money but about 1 in 100 is legit.

>But, am I straight? Bi? Gay? Please don't say "who cares" or "just embrace whatever you like, don't label it" or anything like that. I really need to know.
I know you don't want to hear this, but you need to realise that terms like gay/straight/bi were invented to describe human sexual behaviour. We fucking made it up. These words just reflect the clearest patterns of behaviour we can observe on a population level from our current cultural perspective. That doesn't mean those descriptors will match up to any given individual's subjective experience every time.
Quibbling over whether you're straight/gay/bi is like quibbling over whether your ceiling is truly 'white.' There are millions of slightly different colours that we'd all describe as being 'white' despite looking distinct once you actually put them next to each other. 'White' still describes them all, because white is just a word we made up to encompass the general theme we agree that we see in all these colours. But the colours existed first. A different culture with a different perspective might have a completely different descriptive system for them. But different subjective descriptors don't change the objective nature of the colour.

sub: My life is a fucking mess please help
com:
Background: I grew up with very anti-social and narcissistic / controlling parents who made six figures each. Especially my dad, who I think is autistic.

11 years old, puberty hits, and I am an insta outcast for numerous reasons - I had seizures, my parents didn’t dress me well for school, and any attempts to try to become my own person and grow with my peers was shut down by my parents - “no we won’t let you get new clothes you have clothes”, “no you can’t get rid of your glasses, that costs money”, “no you can’t get an iPod, that costs money”. This led to fights and my parents yelling at me and shutting me down. And I also had a few episodes where I lashed out at my peers who genuinely loved me and wanted me to socialize. Parents were also hyper religious, like “if you have sex before marriage we will disown you as a child”

So I just shut down socially. Permanently. I was too afraid to improve myself and discover the person who I wanted to be out of fear of rejection or getting hurt, and my parents still micromanaged my life. I had a few friends here and there, but nobody I really liked. Teachers always thought I was a good kid.

High school and college flew by me, had no real meaningful experiences. So I just stayed in my room, studied, played video games, didn’t give a fuck. I had a haircut from 4th grade that I maintained at age 22 and still wore graphic t-shirts. Zits, no DO, and I got fat. Of course parents didn’t give two fucks about my well-being, despite being socially aware.

Took out 60k in loans to pay for living expenses.

sub: Why can't I hold down a friendship, why can't I have friends? What is wrong with me?
com:
If you meet me, I am an incredible social person, I can have conversations, I am radiation confidence, I am, in short just a charismatic SOB. The problem starts when I am living somewhere new. I am basically incapable of forming a deeper connection with people or having, yeah, friends and I am incredibly lonely because of this.

I am in my semester abroad where I came a little late, like after the introduction week, but still got on with the people pretty well. A month in, I basically broke off contact with everybody here. I had the same, when I started my 1st year of uni. I have some people I smoke with sometimes and that is it, apart from that I am just in my room 24/7 or in Uni. I cant sleep, I cant do work, I am playing games to avoid my loneliness. I am desperate to go home in a week and fyi, I hate it so much.

The thing is, in the beginning I was like, I don’t want to have friends, but I need friends and then I fell into this vicious cycle where I cant escape anymore. I know, I just need to write some people, pursue my hobbies and so on, but I am absolutely paralysed by fear and anxiety when I have to think about reapproaching people. Furthermore, I do not have any idea what to write them. So I am basically fucked. And I hate myself even more for this. And then I am way to anxious to develop a strategy.

I am so desperate to not be lonely anymore, but I am so deep in my depression with that, that I am on the border of becoming crazy.

Then, the friends I have, I feel only hanging out with because they are the last option I have. And this is a shitty feeling as well.

I don’t want to live like this. I want to go out, I want to have fun, I want to experience live and I do not want to be so fucking lonely anymore.

Hey anons, I got a doubt and wanted to know if anybody had any similar experiences.

This is not about me, but about my gf.

Last week I was driving through a mountain road, around 2000 metres in height (6500 ft for americans), with some turns but not so complicated, and my gf in the passenger seat.
Out of nowhere, my gf starts feeling sick, dizzy and with nausea, until she completely passed out with her eyes gone white.

I got scared tf out and immediately looked for a place where I could stop the car, and fortunately there was a rural house with a very nice lady that got us sugar and water and something to eat for her.

My gf was completely passed out for around 5 minutes and tehn felt like shit for the rest of the day.

Could this be a sign of an underliying health issue or problem? Or can it be caused due to driving in the heights or something?

Im kind of worried desu. She is 23yo, slim and healthy, so I wouldn't know what could it be.

Any anons got any idea or tip?

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>27883512
>passed out for 5 minutes
She should go to a doctor. The average time that someone healthy faints for is 20 seconds. 5 minutes is probably a bad sign. It may have just been that she was particularly vulnerable to altitude sickness but her fainting makes it seem unlikely.

last_replies.com:
>>27883512
There are too many possibilties for us to guess - and they range from trivial to very serious, so she should have a complete physical.

She's got anemia sounds like. Pretty common for slim, healthy young women because they never get enough iron in their diet. The altitude more than likely exacerbated that.

>A man pushes his car until he reaches a hotel. When he arrives, he goes bankrupt. What happened?

Imagine doing that, but getting ‘stuck’ in the thought process. And that for now until the rest of your life, you are ‘stuck’ like that in your head. Non-stop. day in and day out. That’s what it’s like.
